description: More of gdevelop, this extension adds more behaviors
name: GdevelopPlus

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count, with more control over rounding.
eventsFunctions.name: PreciseFPS

parameters.longDescription: This tells how many numbers after the period should be shown.
parameters.name: accuracy

eventsFunctions.description: Attempts to connect to discord if it is installed, and initialize rich presence.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectToDiscord

eventsFunctions.description: Update the data in the rich presence. See the discord documentation for more info on each field. Each field except state is optional.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateRichPresence
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update rich presence to state _PARAM1_, details _PARAM2_, begin timestamp _PARAM3_, end timestamp _PARAM4_, large image _PARAM5_ with text _PARAM6_ and small image _PARAM7_ with text _PARAM8_

parameters.description: The details of the current state
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: The timstamp of the start of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will show the time elapsed since the start.
parameters.name: startTimestamp

parameters.description: The timestamp of the end of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will display the remaining time.
parameters.name: endTimestamp

parameters.description: The name of the big image
parameters.name: largeImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the large image
parameters.name: largeImageText

parameters.description: The name of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageText

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count.
eventsFunctions.name: FPS

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to input the classic Konami Code ("Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, B, A") into a scene for cheats and easter eggs.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: KonamiCode

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if the Konami Code is correctly inputted.
eventsFunctions.name: KC_Inputted

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An item in a flex container.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlexItem

events.comment: Hack: onCreated doesn't has object properties set, use this trigger once to make it like onCreated but after object properties are set.

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the shrink for this object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShrink

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the growth for this object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetGrowth

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the order for this object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetOrder

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the alignement method for this object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAlign

propertyDescriptors.label: The order of the object in the container
propertyDescriptors.name: Order

propertyDescriptors.label: Override the alignement for that object
propertyDescriptors.name: AlignSelf

events.comment: Hack: onCreated doesn't has object properties set, use this trigger once to make it like onCreated but after object properties are set.

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the alignement method for items on the X axis.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set alignement on the X axis
eventsFunctions.name: SetXAlign
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set flexbox X alignement of items of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the alignement method for items on the Y axis.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set alignement on the Y axis
eventsFunctions.name: SetYAlign
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set flexbox Y alignement of items of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the alignement method for the lines/rows of objects in the box.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLineAlign
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set flexbox alignement of lines of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

propertyDescriptors.label: Warpping (adding lines to fit everything inside the Flexbox)
propertyDescriptors.name: Wrap

propertyDescriptors.label: The alignement of the items on the X axis
propertyDescriptors.name: JustifyContent

propertyDescriptors.label: The alignement of the items on the Y axis
propertyDescriptors.name: AlignItems

propertyDescriptors.label: Minimal gap between each item in pixels
propertyDescriptors.name: Gap

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Makes a text object display the current FPS.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FPSDisplayer

propertyDescriptors.label: The prefix before the FPS count
propertyDescriptors.name: prefix

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: If the cursor hovers in an object with this behavior changes the cursor
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ChangeCursorIfIsHover

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change the type of the cursor
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created
Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

events.inlineCode:
// Set cursor to behavior property cursor_type
runtimeScene
    .getGame()
    .getRenderer()
    .getCanvas()
    .style
    .cursor = objects[0]
        .getBehavior(
            eventsFunctionContext.getBehaviorName("Behavior")
        )
        ._getcursor_type();

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: This behavior causes the object that has this behavior to show its hitbox
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShowHitbox
